declaration.code: final func sendMessage(_ content: RCSMessage.FileTransfer, to destination: RCSHandle, using cellularServiceID: CellularServiceID, messageID: RCSMessageID) async throws

overview:
## Discussion

Use this version of the `sendMessage` method in combination with the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/upload(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/download(_:)] methods of `RCSService`.

To send a file to a recipient, call the upload method and use the returned metadata to create a new [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage] with content that’s an instance of [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/FileTransfer].

To receive a file, start by iterating over items in the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications] asynchronous sequence. When you get a message with a content value that’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/Content-swift.enum/fileTransfer(_:)], use the file URL and other metadata in the associated [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/FileTransfer] value to call the download method.

# sendMessage(_:to:using:messageID:)

**Instance Method**

Sends a file transfer message to a specified destination.

## Declaration

```swift
final func sendMessage(_ content: RCSMessage.FileTransfer, to destination: RCSHandle, using cellularServiceID: CellularServiceID, messageID: RCSMessageID) async throws
```

## Parameters

- **content**: The content of the message to send, as an instance of [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/FileTransfer].
- **destination**: The destination handle to send the message to.
- **cellularServiceID**: The service identifier to use for the message.
- **messageID**: The message identifier to use for the message.

## Discussion

Use this version of the `sendMessage` method in combination with the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/upload(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/download(_:)] methods of `RCSService`.

To send a file to a recipient, call the upload method and use the returned metadata to create a new [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage] with content that’s an instance of [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/FileTransfer].

To receive a file, start by iterating over items in the [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSService/incomingMessageNotifications] asynchronous sequence. When you get a message with a content value that’s [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/Content-swift.enum/fileTransfer(_:)], use the file URL and other metadata in the associated [doc://com.apple.availability/documentation/TelephonyMessagingKit/RCSMessage/FileTransfer] value to call the download method.

## Sending messages

- **sendMessage(_:to:using:messageID:)**: Sends a text message to a specified destination.
- **RCSMessage.Text**: A structure that represents text content in an RCS message.
- **RCSMessage.FileTransfer**: A structure that represents file transfer content in an RCS message.
- **sendMessage(_:to:using:messageID:)**: Sends a composing indicator message to a specified destination.
- **RCSMessage.ComposingIndicator**: A structure that represents RFC 3994 composing indicator content in an RCS message.
- **sendMessage(_:to:using:messageID:)**: Sends a geolocation push message to a specified destination.
- **RCSMessage.GeolocationPush**: A structure that represents geolocation push content in an RCS message.
- **sendMessage(_:to:using:messageID:group:)**: Sends the disposition for an incoming message.
- **RCSMessage.DispositionNotification**: A structure that represents disposition notification content in an RCS message, such as whether delivery succeeded or failed.
- **RCSHandle**: An enumeration that represents an RCS destination or sender.
- **CellularServiceID**: An opaque identifier that represents the cellular service for which to provide operations.
- **RCSMessageID**: A structure that represents an RCS message identifier.
